title: 3 Years old, no price change

Champion price reduction occurs when a new champion is released.  Whenever a new champion is released, the oldest champion in the 6300 tier is then dropped to the 4800 tier which is why ziggs got dropped to 4800 when Ekko came out

Which champs are 6300 that are old?
I'm a bit of a newbie myself so I seriously don't know.

Fiora is the oldest 6300 IP champ, and she was released on 2/29/2012.  So she'll be the next champ to get a price reduction, when the next new champion comes out.

Other 6300 IP champs also 3 years old: Lulu, Hecarim, Varus, Darius and Draven.
How long does it take to farm 6,300 IP? I have over 125k so I don't pay attention anymore.

If you only play one game a day, it probably takes a month and a half (assuming average 75 IP per game and ~50% win rate).

If you play 3 games a day, it probably takes about 2.5 weeks.

That's probably not a bad rate for either new players or players "with lives".  You either spend money or you spend time to get those 6300 IP champs.  Between all the champs that are 1350 IP or less and the free champion rotation, there's plenty of options until someone can farm up 6300 IP.

I wish I could go back in time and unspend the $200 I spent on this game for champions (and like 5 skins, but I don't regret those). I've changed my name like 7 times already because I have nothing to spend IP on.

The only reason I have 32k ip is because I already own every single champion and can easily buy every new champion that comes out. I also have all the runes I could possibly need at this point, but for players who are newer or can't put as much time and money into League it can be extremely hard to get up to 63k, especially when you still need to buy runes and stuff.
About a couple of days depending if you can play a all nighter and lose sleep for it.

To do it in 2 days, you'd have to grind 40 games a day.  If you went 48 hours straight with no sleep and played straight through, you would have to average a game every 36 minutes, including queue time and champion select.  That's quite the grind!

6300 IP in 7 days is a solid grind.  You would need about 10 games a day.  At 45 minutes per game (including queue time, champion select, and some break time), it's like playing League as a full time job.
Well assuming that you dont have a life dont go to school and dont work.

I picked the game up three months ago and get about 500~700 IP a day, depending on how much I play. That includes the first win of the day bonus. So 6300 IP takes a little more than a week.
